p.k: Vicious Circle When an elderly lady catches a burglar trying to rob her, she decides to help him go straight. But she has to take a different approach
The Boy Who Talked With Animals When David rescues a giant turtle, it looks as though he's found a new friend. But there could be more to his pet than meets the eye
A look at London's mammoth Battersea Power Station, brought back to life after 30 years of dereliction with designs from architect Jim Eyre
Opera Australia perform one of the world's best-loved romantic operas La Traviata under the stars on a floating, mirrored stage on Sydney Harbour
Arts Uncovered joins the stage managers at the Royal Opera House as they prepare for a new production at the iconic Covent Garden venue
Proof Of Guilt George is denying murder, even though he was in a locked room with the victim when he was shot. Inspector Walters just can't find any evidence against him
Vengeance Is Mine Inc Mrs Wilbur gets more than she bargained for when she calls upon the services of Tom and George, two actors from
A Girl Can't Always Have Everything Struggling actresses Suzy and Pat meet Herbert, a wealthy widower. Seductive Suzy enjoys his money, but things
Parson's Pleasure Cyril Boggis makes a profitable living as a rogue antiques dealer. But when he buys Farmer Rummins' valuable furniture
The Stinker When millionaire Jack runs into Harold, a boy he bullied at school, he gives him a job. But Harold soon suspects his wife of having an affair with his new boss
An intimate profile of Karl Malden, the actor who won an Oscar for his role as Mitch in A Streetcar Named Desire and was nominated for another for On the Waterfront
A look at the career of Anthony Hopkins, the Oscar-winning actor known for roles in films such as The Silence of the Lambs, The Remains of the Day and Amistad
A closer look at the life and career of Faye Dunaway, the Oscar-winning actress known for her roles in Bonnie and Clyde, The Thomas Crown Affair, Chinatown and Network
A look at the short but brilliant career of The Small Faces, featuring interviews with original members and performances of classic hits, including

p.n: The Hollies: Look Through Any Window 1963-1975
p.k: Original members Graham Nash, Allan Clarke, Tony Hicks and Bobby Elliott discuss the history of The Hollies, while reflecting on their most memorable performances
New. Join legendary rock band The Who for an electrifying live performance of their most loved hits, including My Generation and Pinball Wizard
New. 1985 Chaka Khan and Tom Waits perform live on The Tube. Also, new series Bliss brings live sets from the likes of The Cult and Propaganda
Goodbye Yellow Brick Road Footage from the original recording sessions, together with interviews with Elton John, offer a unique insight into the creation

p.n: New: Carole King: Welcome To My Living Room
p.k: New. Filmed in 2005, the renowned singer-songwriter Carole King embarks on her world tour, featuring intimate performances of 21 of her major hits
Rufus Wainwright, Chaka Khan, James Taylor and more come together to celebrate Joni Mitchell's 75th birthday with a special tribute concert filmed in 2018
